g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
factors for a given wind spee
d; taller towers provide access to higher wind speeds
All major onshore wind markets have experienced rapid growth in both r
, and average power ratings (from 1.9 MW in 2010 to 3 MW
in 2020). The generation capacity of offshore wind turbines grew by
a factor of 3.7 in less than two
decades, from 1.6 MW in 2000 to 6 MW in 2020
revolutionize offshore wind power by tapping into the abundant wind potential in deeper waters. This
is particularly important for regions where coastal waters are too deep for fixed
wind turbines. Floating wind farms potentially offer economic and environmental benefits compared
d during installation, but the long
term ecological effects are unknown and meteorological conditions further offshore and in deeper
waters are harsher on wind turbine components
. A radical new class of wind energy
converters has also been conceived under the name of Airborne Wind Energy Systems that can harves
800m), which are inaccessible by traditional wind
. This technology has seen development and testing of small devices
Wind capacity factors have increased over the last decade (
wind farms increased from 27% in 2010 to 36% in 2020
capacity factor has decreased from a peak of 45% in 2017. This has been driven by the increased share
of offshore development in China, where projects are often near
shore and use smaller wind turbines
. Improvements in capacity factors also come from increased
functionality of wind turbines and wind farms. Manufactures can adapt the wind turbine generator to
ines for windy sites have smaller generators and smaller specific capacity per
rotor area, and therefore operate more efficiently and reach full capacity for a longer time period
Electricity from onshore wind is less expensive than electricity generated from fossil fuels in a growing
The global average LCOE onshore declined by 38% from 2010
. However, the decrease in cost varies substantially
by region. Since 2014, wind costs have declined more rapidly
than the majority of experts predicted
. New modelling projects onshore wind LCOE of USD .037 kWh
. The future cost of offshore wind is more uncertain because other aspects besides increases in
